content.body: Can someone confirm that all options(emoji ...) https://github.com/unicode-org/cldr/blob/latest/common/bcp47/collation.xml#L13-L31  are compatible with ECMA402? Except "standard" and "search"  as the spec describe

content.body: that may depend upon what you mean by "compatible". The whole list and even made-up values are accepted by https://tc39.es/ecma402/#sec-initializecollator , but are not guaranteed to make it through ResolveLocale on any given implementation
Thanks Richard Gibson , I was looking at https://tc39.es/ecma402/#sec-intl-collator-internal-slots
content.formatted_body: Thanks Richard Gibson , I was looking at https://tc39.es/ecma402/#sec-intl-collator-internal-slots

content.body: but was unsure if only  those two must not be used or there is any other

content.body: no, those two are singled out because the Collator constructor uses a `usage` property
